title: Rural University Virtual Synchronous Continuous Professional Development (CPD) Science Webinar Course: Exploring Research Trends Through Experimentation, Observation, and Analysis to Derive Evidence-Based Conclusions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge (experimental procedures, observation methods, fundamental analysis techniques) and entry-level expertise in the field (medical/legal/technical). Basic understanding of the scientific inquiry process (experiment design, data measurement, result interpretation)
context.additional_context: Non-degree adult learner program in rural areas operating under low-spec internet/BYOD conditions. Webinar-based intensive short courses addressing post-COVID remote education needs. Content emphasizes observation/measurement/analysis activities to improve scientific inquiry skills, with hands-on tasks focusing on variable control and evidence-based conclusions.

learning_goals: Participants explain 3 recent scientific research trends (hypothesis formulation, variable control, data analysis methods) according to scientific inquiry procedures through webinar participation

Participants utilize ≥90% of real-time interaction features (chat, polls) on mobile devices during webinars and effectively articulate questions arising from scientific inquiry processes from experimental/observational/measurable perspectives

Participants submit a project-based evaluation report within 1 week, describing in ~500 characters how they applied 3+ hypotheses, 2 evidence collection methods, and 1 conclusion derived from the webinar to a real-world case (e.g., quality management process improvement). They achieve "met" ratings in ≥4 out of 5 rubric criteria
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
